page.title: 06Mugginton
page.content:
cards, pens, pencils, rubbers, eggs, honey, and a variety of dog food.
The Village of Mugginton
Mugginton is the second largest village in the area, and we think that it is a Saxon name, proving that there has been a settlement there for a long time. The name was spelt Muginton in the original Domesday Book, and it is believed to mean "the farm of the people who followed Mugga", Mugga being the Saxon lord of the manor. In the village there are 2 farms, one with a modern farmhouse and one with a farmhouse built about 180 years ago, four old houses, 2 cottages, 5 modern houses and 2 modern bungalows. Four farmhouses are now used as dwellings with little or no farmland attached, and one house was formerly
